resources.string: Please pick a state and county
CovidScore calculates your risk of being exposed to COVID-19 within a U.S. county.

To calculate the risk of being exposed to COVID, we need to start with the probability that any one person has COVID, which is a simple division of active cases by total population.

We can interpret the complement of this probability to be the probability that any one person doesn't have COVID.

We then multiply this by itself for as many people as there are in the group, e.g. if the probability of 1 person not having COVID is 0.5, then the probability of 2 people would be 0.5*0.5 = 0.25, for 3 people it would be 0.5*0.5*0.5 = 0.125, and so on.

The resulting value can be interpreted as the probability that nobody in the group has COVID.

So the complement of this can then be interpreted as the probability that someone in the group has COVID, and this is the value that we display to you.
Note: This app uses the Census Bureau Data API but is not endorsed or certified by the Census Bureau.
